law.catch_line: A person shall register with the person's supervising authority if the person is:...

text.section:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a person is no longer subject to registration under this subtitle if:
the underlying conviction requiring registration is reversed, vacated, or set aside; or
the registrant is pardoned for the underlying conviction.

section.section:
If the person has committed a delinquent act that would cause the court to make a determination regarding registration under paragraph (1) of this subsection:
the State's Attorney shall serve written notice to the person or the person's counsel at least 30 days before a hearing to determine if the person is required to register under this section; and
the Department of Juvenile Services shall:
provide the court with any information necessary to make the determination; and
conduct any follow-up the court requires.

The form of petitions and all other pleadings under this subsection and, except as otherwise provided under Title 3 of the Courts and Judicial Proceedings Article, the procedures to be followed by the court under this subsection shall be specified in the Maryland Rules.
The court may order an evaluation of the person in making the determination under paragraph (1) of this subsection.
